factor.title: Factor
factor.text: A number a is a factor (or divisor) of a number b, if you can divide b by a without remainder.

multiple.title: Multiple
multiple.text: A number a is a multiple of a number b, if b is a factor of a.

prime.title: Prime Number
prime.text: A prime number is an integer that has no divisors other than 1 and itself.

primefactor.title: Prime Factor
primefactor.text: A prime factor of a number is simply a factor which is prime.

factorisation.title: Prime Factorisation
factorisation.text: The prime factorisation of a number is a way to write it as a product of prime numbers.

fta.title: Fundamental Theorem of Arithemtic
fta.text: The FTA says that every integer has a unique prime factorisation.

proof.title: Proof
proof.text: A proof is a logical argument that shows beyond any doubt that a certain statement is true or false.

lcm.title: Lowest Common Multiple
lcm.text: The lcm of two numbers a and b is the smallest integer that is a multiple of both a and b.

gcd.title: Greatest Common Divisor
gcd.text: The gcd of two numbers a and b is the largest integer that is a divisor of both a and b.

cryptography.title: Cryptography
cryptography.text: Cryptography is an area of mathematics thatâ€˜s about enciphering and deciphering secret messages.

twins.title: Twin Primes
twins.text: Twin primes are pairs of prime numbers like 17 and 19 which are just 2 apart.
